reviews.text: Tickets must be bought on train (which is rare) but more usually at arrival station which is a pain but can allow for easier fare skipping if there are no barriers at your destination

Not pleasant!

A complete nightmare, if you can, go elsewhere! One train per hour into Birmingham which is over subscribed and at maximum capacity! I never manage to get a seat, the passengers who board at Wilnecote feel more like they are on the tube, very cramped and squashed together. The train fare on this 10 min journey is 3 times more the cost of similar journeys from Birmingham stations, its a rip off!

One plus, it now has a fast ticket machine at the station, so you can purchase a ticket before you board. If not you will be very lucky if a Ticket Master will be able to get through the carriage so you can buy a ticket on the train, more often they cant get through and you end up waiting for 30 mins at New Street in a queue just to get a ticket so you can get out of the station.

I really wouldnt recommend, unless you are desperate!

Good station . 2 platforms . Trains going to Birmingham , Derby , Nottingham and Cardiff central . So covers good distance of country. Live local to it . Only 2 minuits to tamworth ( high level ) . Clean   nice station overall . Fairly big car park just over the road .

Basic station, 2 platforms with shelters on either side. Sadly there is no way to buy a ticket, there are no automated machines so you have to reply on buying in advance or on the train. Trains to birmingham every hour, except Sunday's there is about 1. Nice clean station though.
